info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE, WESTERN PICKAWAY AND SOUTHEASTERN MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Bloomingburg, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Washington Court House, Mount Sterling, Williamsport, Bloomingburg, New Holland, Commercial Point, Fox, Darbyville, Deer Creek Lake, Madison Mills, State Route 207 at US Route 22, State Route 138 at US Route 22, Pancoastburg and Derby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
